data.title: The 45+ Best NBA Dallas Mavericks Point Guards
data.meta_description: Over 300 sports fans have voted on the 45+ Best NBA Dallas Mavericks Point Guards. Current Top 3: Luka Dončić, Jason Kidd, Steve Nash
data.text:
Ranked By

1.9K votes

398 voters

3 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Dallas Mavericks

Latest additions: Kyrie Irving

Most divisive: Rajon Rondo

Over 300 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 45+ Best NBA Dallas Mavericks Point Guards

Big fan of Dallas basketball? Then check out this list of Dallas Mavericks point guards. It includes almost every point guard from throughout Dallas Mavericks history, including current point guards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA point guards of all time, the best Mavericks PGs include Jason Kidd, Steve Nash, Derek Harper, and Brad Davis.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Dallas Mavs starting PGs and backup PGs are Luka Doncic, Jalen Brunson, Frank Ntilikina, and Trey Burke.

Who are the best point guards in Dallas Mavericks history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Dallas Mavericks point guard of all time!

Dallas Mavericks: 2018-2022

Emerging as a prodigy, Luka Dončić was drafted by the Mavericks in 2018 with a rare combination of size, skill, and basketball IQ that instantly elevated him to the elite ranks of NBA point guards. Known for his remarkable court vision, dazzling passing ability, and a penchant for big-time shots, he quickly established himself as the team's leader and captured the 2019 NBA Rookie of the Year Award. As a triple-double machine, Dončić has been named to two All-NBA First Teams and has become a fixture at the All-Star Game, stamping his name in Maverick's history.

Birthplace : San Francisco, California

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Dallas Mavericks, Phoenix Suns, New Jersey Nets, New York Knicks

Position : Point guard

Dallas Mavericks: ​​​​​1994–1996, 2008–2012

Originally drafted by the Mavericks in 1994, Jason Kidd returned to the team in 2008 via a blockbuster trade and became known for his tenacious defense, pinpoint passing, and unmatched basketball instincts. A tireless worker and true floor general, Kidd earned multiple All-Defensive Team honors and All-NBA Team selections during his time in Dallas. The crowning achievement of his career came in 2011 when he helped lead the Mavericks to their first NBA championship, cementing his place among the franchise's all-time greats.

Birthplace : Johannesburg, South Africa

Nationality : Canada

Team : Dallas Mavericks, Phoenix Suns, Los Angeles Lakers

Position : Point guard

Dallas Mavericks: 1998-2004

Arriving in Dallas in 1998 through a trade, Steve Nash blossomed into a game-changing force, forming a powerful partnership with Dirk Nowitzki and establishing an up-tempo, high-scoring offense. Known for his fearless drives, deft passing touch, and deadly long-range shooting, Nash brought excitement and success to the Mavericks during his tenure. Although he never won a championship with Dallas, he was an integral part of the team's early 2000s renaissance, earning two All-NBA Third Team selections before departing for Phoenix in 2004.

Birthplace : Georgia, USA, Royston

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Point guard

Dallas Mavericks: 1983–1994, 1996–1997

A steady and reliable presence in the Mavericks backcourt for over a decade, Derek Harper played a pivotal role in the team's rise to prominence during the 1980s. Drafted in 1983, Harper earned a reputation for tenacious defense, consistently ranking among the league leaders in steals and earning two All-Defensive Second Team selections. Offensively, his steady ball-handling, unerring jumper, and clutch shooting made him a key component of some of the most successful Mavericks teams in franchise history.

Birthplace : Seattle, Washington

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Dallas Mavericks

Position : Point guard, Shooting guard

Dallas Mavericks: 2004-2012

Acquired in a trade in 2004, Jason Terry became a fan favorite in Dallas due to his electrifying energy, clutch shooting, and unwavering confidence. Serving as both a starting point guard and sixth man, "The Jet" provided instant scoring punch and leadership for the Mavericks, playing a crucial role in the team's 2011 championship run. Known for key buzzer-beaters and timely steals, Terry became a Dallas legend, earning an NBA Sixth Man of the Year award in 2009 and etching his name in Mavericks history.

Birthplace : Chicago, Illinois, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Team : United States of America

Position : Point guard

Dallas Mavericks: 2001-2002

Acquired by the Mavericks in a trade midway through the 2001 season, Tim Hardaway brought his unique brand of flashy ball handling and fearless shooting to the team during a brief yet memorable stint. Known for his killer crossover and lightning-quick release, Hardaway quickly became a fan favorite in Dallas, adding a new dimension to the team's offensive arsenal. Though his time in Dallas was short-lived, Hardaway's scoring prowess and flair for the dramatic endeared him to fans and teammates alike.
